resources.string:
The Kingsville Recycling Center provides the community a convenient and efficient method of diversion of renewable resources from the city landfill, the education of recycling to the public, and to continue the pursuit of meeting the goals of SB1340 by the State of Texas. The Recycling Center collaborates with Sanitation Division and Landfill Division to collect the cityâ€™s recycling. 

Below is a list of acceptable materials 
(Paper, Plastic, Aluminum and Cardboard).

Attention: Maryann Trejo
 Mailing: P.O. Box 1458 Kingsville, TX 78364
 Physical: 202 W. Lee Kingsville, TX 78363
 Phone: (361) 595-8093
 Fax: (361) 595-8042
 E-Mail: mtrejo@cityofkingsville.com

Monday - Friday:
 7:30a.m. - 12:00p.m.
 1:00p.m. - 4:30p.m.
 1st and 3rd saturday:
 9:00a.m. - 12:00p.m.

 Closed on all City Holidays

 *After hours drop-off is available via side entrance

ABC Recycling is classified under scrap and waste materials wholesale and has been in business for 6 to 9 years. ABC Recycling is a public business which buys SCRAP METAL. The materials they buy vary from cans, scrap aluminum, copper, brass, stainless steel, car batteries, lead, motors, and more.

 Anyone who is interested in making a small profit or big depending on the price and weight of the collected material can go the ABC Recycling to get apprised.

 Their value of the materials are referred from the CMC Recycling company from Corpus Christi which pays top dollar for scrap metal.

 Once in there hands, ABC compacts the materials, if possible, to make room for more materials.

CMC Recycling is committed to preserving and protecting our environment for future generations. We utilize the most modern processing technologies in a way that minimizes the impact on the environment. Compliance with national and local regulations is viewed as the minimum requirements by our facilities. We continually strive to find improved solutions for protecting our environment.

Location: Kingsville
 Physical: 708 S. Sixth St Kingsville, Texas 78363
 Phone: (361)592-3443

Location: Corpus Christi
 Physical: 4702 Leopard St Corpus Christi, Texas 78408
Phone: (361)884-2296
The city of kingsville does not enforce recycling, Recycling is done on a voluntary basis.

If you have any old cell phones that you want to recycle, bring them to the Recycling Center. No accessories please, only the cell phone with the battery.

 Document shredding is available by appointment. Please call the office. The cost is $0.15 per pound. Presentations and on/off-site tours for groups, organizations, and schools are available by appointment.

 The Recycled Reading Room is open. Books are available to take, return, keep or share. Volunteers are always welcome.

The Recycling Center uses a Single Stream Process.

 Single Stream Recycling refers to a system in which all kinds of recyclables such as plastics, paper, metals, glass etc. are put into a single bin by consumers. Afterward, the recyclables are collected and transported to a material Recovery Facility (MRF) where they are sorted and processed. 

 In this case the recycling center uses the services of Republic Services from Corpus Christi

The campus of Texas A&M University - Kingsville (TAMUK) is very supportive of recycling. Many programs are provided to keep the campus clean and green. Sustainability and Recycling are a underlined focus when speaking of such programs. Many of which were incorporated by The Office of Sustainability.

Campus Sustainability promotes the stewardship of societal and environmental resources by developing and joining in initiatives both internal and external to our campus, in order to cultivate the spirit of sustainability throughout the Javelina Nation and for future generations.

Campus Sustainability promotes the stewardship of societal and environmental resources by developing and joining in initiatives both internal and external to our campus. Located in the Javelina Student Engagement Center (JSEC), the door is always open to students, faculty, staff, administrators and the Kingsville community.

TAMUK campus recycling is trucked to the Kingsville Recycling Center where it is checked for contamination before being sent to Corpus Christi. If a bag of recyclables has any food or drink contamination, the entire batch is thrown away as garbage.

 From the Corpus Christi Recycling Center it is shipped to recycling plants so that the materials can be re-introduced into industrial production. Therefore we are only able to recycle materials that Corpus Christi recycles.*

 Mixed paper: newspaper, office paper, clean paper bags, paperboard boxes, etc.

 Plastic & Metal: milk jugs, water bottles, plastic with triangle symbols 1-6 (but no Styrofoam or wrappers) & steel cans, aluminum cans,clean foil

 Garbage is garbage!: Keep it out of the recycling bins! it all goes to the landfill: food contaminants, non-recyclable plastics, etc.

With a few exceptions, it is the responsibility of the Recycling staff to transport materials from various containers throughout the campus, located internally and externally of university buildings. The University is running the special service to transport recyclable waste to the Kingsville Recycling Center.

The Recycling Program is housed within the Department of Risk Management & Sustainability. In 2011, the Recycling Program was integrated with the City of Kingsville well-established waste management resources in order to increase efficiency and the recovery of materials diverted from the solid waste stream.

There are the bins you will find in locations across campus, both indoors and outdoors. Blue bins are for recycling and brown bins are for garbage - keep it separate!

 Residence Halls > students > indoor large blue bins > emptied by recycling crew

 Offices bins > faculty and staff > indoor large blue bins > emptied by recycling crew

 Indoor large blue bins > campus community > emptied by recycling crew

 Outdoor blue roll-out bins > custodial staff > emptied by recycling crew

 Outdoor cages > campus community > emptied by recycling crew
